revised_title: Alloimmune Hierarchies and Stress-Induced Reversals in Chimeric Protochordate Colonies
tldr: This study investigates the resorption phenomenon in chimeric colonies of the protochordate Botryllus schlosseri. Researchers found that stress conditions can induce reversals in the resorption directionality, and they propose that non-programmed cell deaths, triggered by stress, may cause these reversals. The findings provide insights into the complex interactions and hierarchy within chimeric colonies.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
